reviewText: it went off too quick and only 1 good sex scene
It was kind of boring.  It was ok to watch but I wouldn't watch it again.
Sorry but I did not see anything compelling in this show.  No tension no anticipation and a less the thrilling resolution.

Like Sofia Coppola's "Somewhere" and some scenes from "12 Years A Slave", the film is a window on characters living in anticipation. Making inaction visually interesting is an art within the art of film-making; but I feel this film pulls it off, helped by good cinematography,  a colorful setting and and the engaging female lead, Adriana Paz.

Not being a person who views films as an art form, I don't sit and watch the portrait as it gets painted then critique the brush strokes and colors used.
  I watch films like this for two reasons, a decent-simple storyline supported with at least 2-3 great sex scenes, and I almost got what I desire out of this film.  Adriana Paz is a pretty hot woman and she does well, I would have given this film 5stars but the film sort of drags a bit.
  We have a 17yr old boy running operations of his uncle's beach-front motel, a dumpy place yet erotic. In comes the star of the film a 25-30yr old woman ( Adriana Paz ) hot, visits her "lover" at the motel property- some married guy with very script time in the film.  The film would have been much greater if the film focused a bit more on Sebastian and Miranda either on the bed or on the beach, although I really enjoyed the scene where she gets on top of him and rides the boy into heaven.
  Ideal story line- taboo, young boy, mature hot woman, just could have been better and maybe 30 minutes longer with a few more intense love scenes.
Over all, the film will bore most people, but I watch films like this for the sexual behavior; I like "skin flicks"
A simple film yet it kept my interest.
